newsitem.title: INDIA: CRICKET-RHODES HELPS SOUTH AFRICA BEAT INDIA.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-RHODES HELPS SOUTH AFRICA BEAT INDIA.

text.p: A breezy half-century by
Jonty Rhodes helped South Africa score their third consecutive
victory over hosts India in the Titan Cup limited-overs
triangular series on Tuesday.
South African openers Gary Kirsten and Herschelle Gibbs,
chasing an Indian score of 186 in 50 overs, scored freely in a
stand of 62.
But the South Africans lost two quick wickets and the run
rate dropped against the wiles of the Indian spinners.
Man-of-the-Match Rhodes made 54 off 77 balls, including four
fours and a mighty six, before he was caught by Ajay Jadeja off
Venkatesh Prasad with victory in sight.
Indian captain Sachin Tendulkar won the toss and elected to
bat but his team failed to prosper. Both Navjot Sidhu and Rahul
Dravid were run out.
Javagal Srinath, batting number three, hit a determined 53
in an otherwise lacklustre Indian batting performance.
India's total of 185, their lowest in the competition,
looked an easy target but the South Africans reached it with
only eight balls to spare.
"We did not want to treat it as an easy task and wanted to
concentrate on the job at hand," South African skipper Hansie
Cronje said.
"And it wasn't easy either, especially when the spinners
came on."
Tendulkar accused his team of failing to play to their
potential.
"The senior players ought to show greater responsibility,"
he said. "You cannot have experienced players getting run out so
early."
South Africa have 10 points from five matches and play
Australia in their last match at the north eastern city of
Guwahati on Thursday.
India have three points from a win and an abandoned match
against Australia, who are third with one point. India and
Australia meet for the third time on November 3.
